001package imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic;
002
003import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
004import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
005
006import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
007import java.util.Locale;
008
009import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.twod.Vector2D;
010
011import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic;
012
013/** 
014 * Interface specifying the behavior of simple 2D points. 
015 * It is used to adapt to different (legacy) point implementations 
016 * with a common API. 
017 * To some extent this is similar to the functionality provided by
018 * {@link java.awt.geom.Point2D} and {@link java.awt.Point}
019 * but was re-implemented to avoid dependency on AWT and for
020 * more flexibility in naming and class structure.
021 * Since defined as an interface, {@link Pnt2d} can be easily implemented 
022 * by other point-like structures, e.g. corners 
023 * (see {@link imagingbook.pub.corners.Corner}).
024 * <br>
025 * Two concrete (nested) classes are defined for points with {@code double}
026 * and {@code int} coordinates, respectively.
027 * See {@link Pnt2d.PntDouble} and {@link Pnt2d.PntInt} for how
028 * to instantiate such point objects.
029 * 
030 */
031public interface Pnt2d {
032        
033        double getX();
034        double getY();
035        
036        // ----------------------------------------------------------
037        
038        public default double[] toDoubleArray() {
039                return new double[] {this.getX(), this.getY()};
040        }
041        
042        public default java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double toAwtPoint2D() {
043                return new java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double(this.getX(), this.getY());
044        }
045        
046        public default Vector2D toVector2D() {
047                return new Vector2D(getX(), getY());
048        }
049        
050        public default Pnt2d duplicate() {
051                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
052        }
053        
054        public default Pnt2d plus(Pnt2d p) {
055                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
056        }
057        
058        public default Pnt2d plus(double dx, double dy) {
059                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
060        }
061        
062        public default Pnt2d plus(int dx, int dy) {
063                return plus((double)dx, (double)dy);
064        }
065        
066        public default Pnt2d minus(Pnt2d p) {
067                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
068        }
069        
070        // ----------------------------------------------------------
071
072        public default boolean equals(Pnt2d p) {
073                return isZero(this.getX() - p.getX()) && isZero(this.getY() - p.getY());
074        }
075        
076        // ----------------------------------------------------------
077        
078        public default double distance2(Pnt2d p) {
079                return sqr(this.getX() - p.getX()) + sqr(this.getY() - p.getY());
080        }
081        
082        public default double distance(Pnt2d p) {
083                return Math.sqrt(this.distance2(p));
084        }
085        
086        // ----------------------------------------------------------
087        
088        /**
089         * Immutable 2D point with {@code double} coordinates.
090         * This class implements the {@link Pnt2d} interface.
091         * <br>
092         * A public constructor ({@link #PntDouble(double, double)})
093         * is provided but the preferred way of instantiation is
094         * by one of the static factory methods, such as
095         * {@link #from(double, double)},
096         * {@link #from(double[])}, etc.
097         * <br>
098         * Access to the coordinate values is provided by the methods
099         * {@link #getX()} and {@link #getY()}, but the
100         * actual field variables {@link #x}, {@link #y} are also 
101         * publicly accessible (for better performance and less clutter).
102         */
103        public class PntDouble implements Pnt2d {
104                
105                public static final PntDouble ZERO = PntDouble.from(0, 0);
106
107                public final double x, y;
108
109                private PntDouble(double x, double y) {
110                        this.x = x;
111                        this.y = y;
112                }
113                
114                @Override
115                public double getX() {
116                        return x;
117                }
118
119                @Override
120                public double getY() {
121                        return y;
122                }
123                
124                @Override
125                public PntDouble duplicate() {
126                        return new PntDouble(this.x, this.y);
127                }
128                
129                // addition -----------------------------------
130                
131                @Override
132                public PntDouble plus(Pnt2d p) {
133                        return new PntDouble(this.x + p.getX(), this.y + p.getY());
134                }
135                
136                @Override
137                public PntDouble plus(double dx, double dy) {
138                        return new PntDouble(this.x + dx, this.y + dy);
139                }
140                
141                // subtraction -----------------------------------
142                
143                @Override
144                public PntDouble minus(Pnt2d p) {
145                        return new PntDouble(this.x - p.getX(), this.y - p.getY());
146                }
147                
148                // misc -----------------------------------
149                
150                @Override
151                public String toString() {
152                        return String.format(Locale.US, "%s[%.3f, %.3f]", 
153                                        getClass().getSimpleName(), x, y);
154                }
155                
156                @Override
157            public int hashCode() {     // taken from awt.Point2D.Double
158                long bits = java.lang.Double.doubleToLongBits(this.x);
159                bits ^= java.lang.Double.doubleToLongBits(this.y) * 31;
160                return (((int) bits) ^ ((int) (bits >> 32)));
161            }
162                
163                // static factory methods
164                
165                public static PntDouble from(double x, double y) {
166                        return new PntDouble(x, y);
167                }
168                
169                public static PntDouble from(double[] xy) {
170                        return new PntDouble(xy[0], xy[1]);
171                }
172                
173                public static PntDouble from(Pnt2d p) {
174                        return new PntDouble(p.getX(), p.getY());
175                }
176                
177                public static PntDouble from(Point2D p) {
178                        return new PntDouble(p.getX(), p.getY());
179                }
180                
181                public static PntDouble from(Vector2D vec) {
182                        return new PntDouble(vec.getX(), vec.getY());
183                }       
184                
185        }
186        
187        // ----------------------------------------------------------
188        
189        /**
190         * Immutable 2D point with {@code int} coordinates.
191         * This class implements the {@link Pnt2d} interface.
192         * <br>
193         * A public constructor ({@link #PntInt(int, int)})
194         * is provided but the preferred way of instantiation is
195         * by one of the static factory methods, such as
196         * {@link #from(int, int)},
197         * {@link #from(int[])}, etc.
198         * <br>
199         * The {@code int} coordinates can only be retrieved via the
200         * publicly accessible field variables {@link #x}, {@link #y},
201         * while the methods {@link #getX()} and {@link #getY()}
202         * return {@code double} values for compatibility reasons.
203         * 
204         */
205        public final class PntInt implements Pnt2d {
206                
207                public static final PntInt ZERO = PntInt.from(0, 0);
208                
209                public final int x, y;
210                
211                public PntInt(int x, int y) {
212                        this.x = x;
213                        this.y = y;
214                }
215
216                @Override
217                public double getX() {
218                        return x;
219                }
220
221                @Override
222                public double getY() {
223                        return y;
224                }
225                
226                @Override
227                public PntInt duplicate() {
228                        return new PntInt(this.x, this.y);
229                }
230                
231                // addition -----------------------------------
232                
233                @Override
234                public PntInt plus(Pnt2d p) {
235                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {               
236                                return new PntInt(this.x + ((PntInt)p).x, this.y + ((PntInt)p).y);
237                        }
238                        else throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot add " + p.getClass().getSimpleName() + " to " +
239                                        this.getClass().getSimpleName());
240                }
241                
242                @Override
243                public PntInt plus(double dx, double dy) {
244                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot add (double, double) to " +
245                                        this.getClass().getSimpleName());
246                }
247                
248                @Override
249                public PntInt plus(int dx, int dy) {
250                        return new PntInt(this.x + dx, this.y + dy);
251                }
252                
253                // subtraction -----------------------------------
254                
255                @Override
256                public PntInt minus(Pnt2d p) {
257                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {               
258                                return new PntInt(this.x - ((PntInt)p).x, this.y - ((PntInt)p).y);
259                        }
260                        else throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot subtract " + p.getClass().getSimpleName() + " from " +
261                                        this.getClass().getSimpleName());
262                }
263                
264                // equality -----------------------------------
265                
266                public boolean equals(Pnt2d p) {
267                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {
268                                return this.equals((PntInt) p);
269                        }
270                        else {
271                                return Arithmetic.isZero(this.x - p.getX()) && Arithmetic.isZero(this.y - p.getY());
272                        }
273                }
274                
275                public boolean equals(PntInt p) {
276                        return (this.x == p.x) && (this.y == p.y);
277                }
278                
279                // misc -----------------------------------
280                
281                @Override
282                public String toString() {
283                        return String.format(Locale.US, "%s[%d, %d]", 
284                                        getClass().getSimpleName(), x, y);
285                }
286                
287                
288                @Override
289                public int hashCode() {
290                        return (17 + this.x) * 37 + this.y;     
291                }
292                
293                // static factory methods --------------------------------------
294                
295                public static PntInt from(int x, int y) {
296                        return new PntInt(x, y);
297                }
298                
299                public static PntInt from(PntInt p) {
300                        return new PntInt(p.x, p.y);
301                }
302                
303                public static PntInt from(int[] xy) {
304                        return new PntInt(xy[0], xy[1]);
305                }
306                
307                public static PntInt from(Pnt2d p) {
308                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {
309                                return ((PntInt) p).duplicate();
310                        }
311                        else {
312                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot convert to " +
313                                                        PntInt.class.getSimpleName());
314                        }
315                }
316                
317                public static PntInt from(java.awt.Point p) {
318                        return new PntInt(p.x, p.y);
319                }
320                
321                // static conversion methods
322                
323                public int[] toIntArray() {
324                        return new int[] {this.x, this.y};
325                }
326                
327                public java.awt.Point toAwtPoint() {
328                        return new java.awt.Point(this.x, this.y);
329                }
330        }
331}
